business.headline: Bitcoin prices surge past $69,000: What's driving the rally? Bitcoin touched $69,408.1 (roughly Rs 58,35,227) on international exchanges on Monday, marking a recovery after the cryptocurrency was in a price slump for the last three months.
Bajaj Housing Finance Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% YoY to Rs 546 croreThe revenue from operations also saw a significant rise, with the company reporting Rs 2,410 crore for Q2FY25.

Health Insurer Niva Bupa gets Sebi nod for Rs 3,000 crore IPO. Details hereThe IPO, which the company filed for back in June, will consist of a mix of Rs 800 crore in fresh shares and an offer for sale (OFS) that includes Rs 320 crore from Bupa Singapore Holdings and Rs 1,880 crore from Fettle Tone LLP.
Sensex, Nifty fall as IT and metal stocks drag markets lowerThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 73.48 points to close at 81,151.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.95 points to end at 24,781.10.

Hyundai IPO GMP improves slightly ahead of market listing. What to expect?Hyundai stock market listing: The initial public offering, which opened on October 15, has seen a rollercoaster ride in terms of investor interest and grey market performance.

Manappuram Finance shares drop 5% today, 24% in 8 days: What's behind fall?The shares of Manappuram Finance hit a low of Rs 145.50, marking a decline of nearly 24% over the past eight trading sessions.

No GST on life and health insurance? Here's how it will impact youThis change, if implemented, could bring relief to policyholders and support the insurance sector by lowering the costs of these essential services.

Tata Consumer Products shares plunge over 7% today. Here's whyTata Consumer Products share price: At 1:27 pm, the stock was trading at Rs 1015.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down by 7.2%, as investors reacted to its muted performance.

RBL Bank shares crash 15% after Q2 results: What analysts are sayingRBL Bank share price: The private lender's shares plunged in intraday trading following the release of its Q2 FY25 earnings over the weekend.

Hyundai Motor India share price expectation: Check latest gmp before D-Street debut Hyundai Motor India IPO: The public issue opened on October 15, was initially met with hesitation from investors, but by the close on Thursday, October 17, 2024, it had been subscribed more than twice.
Explained: Why Kotak Mahindra Bank shares plunged 7% after Q2 resultsAt 1:02 pm, Kotak Mahindra Bank shares were down 5.18% to Rs 1,773 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

Axis Bank shares dip slightly today after strong Q2 gains. Good time to buy? Despite a strong Q2, analysts are divided on Axis Bank's future prospects. Many brokerages have adjusted their target prices, reflecting a cautious outlook on the bank's near-term growth trajectory.

Waaree Energies IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe Waaree Energies IPO consists of a fresh issue of 2.4 crore shares, amounting to Rs 3,600 crore, along with an offer for sale of 0.48 crore shares, totalling Rs 721.44 crore.

Wipro shares gain 1% in early trade. What investors need to knowThe stock's rise comes after Wipro posted better-than-expected Q2 results, including a 21.3% year-on-year (YoY) increase in net profit to Rs 3,209 crore and the announcement of a 1:1 bonus issue.

Adar Poonawalla acquires 50% stake in Karan Johar's Dharma ProductionsKaran Johar's Dharma Productions sells 50% stake to Adar Poonawalla: The deal, valued at Rs 1,000 crore, will see Poonawalla's Serene Production acquire a 50% stake in the renowned production house, with Johar retaining the remaining 50%.
Sensex, Nifty open marginally lower dragged by FMCG stocks; HDFC Bank up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 70.87 points to 81,153.88, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 58.90 points to 24,795.15

Domestic mutual funds boost Paytm stake by 1% this quarter, total holdings now at 8%The latest shareholding pattern filed by the company shows a 1% increase in stake by mutual funds as the trust grows on the brand and its ability to bounce back.

Succession Wars: How betrayal, murder and greed tore apart 'House of Gucci'Maurizio Gucci's quest to perfect the family empire ended in four gunshots on March 27, 1995, on the steps of his Milan office.

Isha Ambani is Harper's Bazaar Icon of the Year, dedicates award to mother, daughterIsha Ambani dedicated the award to her mother, Nita Ambani, the Chairperson of Reliance Foundation. Isha said her mother is her role model who has "paved the way for me".

Centre recommends reducing GST on packaged water and bicycles below Rs 10,000The Group of Ministers (GoM) to decide on GST on health and life insurance premiums in its meeting on Saturday decided to exempt GST on premiums paid by individuals, other than senior citizens, for health insurance with coverage of up to Rs 5 lakh.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Babita Phogat planned wrestlers' protest to become federation chief: Sakshi MalikWrestler Sakshi Malik has claimed that BJP leader Babita Phogat encouraged the wrestlers' protest against Brij Bhushan Singh, alleging Phogat sought to become the president of the Wrestling Federation of India.

S Jaishankar calls out Canada's hypocrisy in dealing with foreign diplomatsExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar highlighted Canada's double standards when it comes to collecting information in foreign countries and restricting such activities on its soil by diplomats of foreign nations.

Man killed after being hit by Mercedes in Thane, driver on the runAccording to the police, the incident occurred when Darshan Hegde was returning home after purchasing food. The Mercedes, reportedly heading towards the Nashik Highway, hit him and fled the scene.

Can India trust China amid talks over disengagement along LAC? What experts sayExperts suggest that while this is a significant step in diffusing tensions between the two countries, India should be cautious about China's motives.

Woman who survived October 7 Hamas attack dies by suicide on 22nd birthdayShirel Golan survived the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack at the Supernova music festival in Israel. She was found dead at her home on her 22nd birthday.

Congress announces 21 candidates for Jharkhand Assembly electionsThe Congress released its first list of candidates for the Jharkhand Assembly election. The senior Congress leader Ajoy Kumar is among the 21 candidates named by the party.

PM Modi to depart for Russia to attend Brics Summit, meet Putin todayThe Summit, under the theme "Strengthening Multilateralism for Just Global Development and Security", will provide an important platform for leaders to discuss key global issues. It will also offer a valuable opportunity to assess the progress of initiatives launched by Brics and to identify potential areas for future collaboration.

Ruturaj Gaikwad to lead India A on Australia tour, Ishan Kishan named wicketkeeperThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) named a 15-member India A squad for the Australia tour on Monday, October 21 announcing Ruturaj Gaikwad as captain.

McDonald's stresses electoral neutrality after Trump's gig: We are goldenMcDonald's clarified that it did not endorse any presidential candidate after Republican candidate Donald Trump's gig at a Pennsylvania outlet dragged the fast food giants into election drama.

Doctors protesting in Kolkata end hunger strike after meeting Mamata BanerjeeProtesting junior doctors ended their hunger strike after they held a two-hour-long meeting with Mamata Banerjee, which was streamed live from the state secretariat, Nabanna.

PM likely to hold bilateral talks with BRICS leaders: Indian envoy to RussiaIn an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Vinay Kumar spoke about the importance of the gathering of top world leaders for the Summit and the significance of BRICS for India and for the global order.

Why India is cooperating with US in Pannun case but not in Canada's Nijjar probeThe US and Canada look to be coordinating their probes into the alleged role of India-linked agents in the plot against two Khalistani terrorists. While India is cooperating with the US in the Gurpatwant Singh Pannun probe, it has rejected Canada's charges in the Hardeep Singh Nijjar case. This is why India is taking divergent stances.
How the hoarding of rail tickets is getting tougherThe shorter, 60-day advance booking period from November 1 will help reduce the fraudulent misuse of early reservation of train berths.

Why Chandrababu Naidu wants you to make more babiesAndhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu sparked a discussion over India's two-child policy by saying the country needed to think of a demographic dividend beyond 2047. His Tamil Nadu counterpart, MK Stalin, too, highlighted how the southern states were losing out due to strict population control. Is there merit in Naidu's argument?

Security guard attacked after denying car entry to no-parking zone in Tamil NaduThe video captured the driver accelerating and hitting the security guard with the car. The situation escalated when one woman got out of the car and slapped the guard.
Woman kills husband on Karwa Chauth by serving him poisoned macaroni for dinnerShe allegedly poisoned her husband after breaking her fast on Karwa Chauth. He died in the hospital.

Hyderabad driver warns couples against romance in his cab: 'Not your private place'Venkatesh, a resident of Hyderabad, discovered the note when he boarded the cab, capturing the driver's lighthearted yet firm message.

Man who threatened Salman Khan apologises, claims it was a mistakeThe apology message was sent from the same WhatsApp account that had earlier threatened Salman Khan and demanded Rs 5 crore from him if he wished to remain safe and resolve the conflict with Lawrence Bishnoi.

Man tries to jump from 14th floor of Noida building, saved by residentsA video of the incident, captured by a resident, shows the man barely hanging from the edge of the balcony. Two people come from behind and rescue him.

Cyclone Dana likely to form over Bay of Bengal, hit Odisha-Bengal on October 24The cyclonic storm is expected to intensify into a depression by October 22 morning and a cyclonic storm by October 23, before moving towards the northwest Bay of Bengal, nearing the Odisha-West Bengal coast by the morning of October 24.

When Alauddin Khilji invaded South India and faced the YadavasFor centuries, invaders from the West breached India's northern borders, but the southern part of India remained unexposed to these invaders. With Alauddin Khilji's conquest of Devagiri, the Yadava capital in the South, it became the gateway to the Deccan, marking the Delhi Sultanate's expansion into the wealth-laden southern lands.

How a Rs 5,000-crore drug recovery reveals a bigger menaceThe Gujarat coastline has come under the scanner following recoveries of cocaine in Delhi leading to a factory in Ankleshwar where 518 kg of the contraband brought from South America was found

India, China agree to patrolling along LAC 'leading to disengagement'Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said on Monday that India and China had reached an agreement on patrolling arrangements along the Line of Actual Control (LAC).

Indian Army recovers huge cache of weapons, ammunition from ManipurThe Indian Army, Manipur Police, Assam Rifles and other security forces recovered a large cache of weapons in a joint operation. The ammunition has been handed over to the Manipur Police.

Shraddha Kapoor to join Allu Arjun in special dance number in Pushpa 2: ReportThe much-anticipated film, Pushpa 2, will reportedly include a special dance number featuring Bollywood actor Shraddha Kapoor alongside Allu Arjun. The film is set to release in theatres in December 2024.

Arshad Warsi on facing backlash for his 'joker' comment on PrabhasActor Arshad Warsi has finally reacted to the backlash he faced after likening Prabhas' look in Kalki 2898 AD to that of a joker. Warsi said that the incident has made him more cautious.

Britney Spears marries self: The most brilliant thing I have doneSinger Britney Spears made a surprising announcement, declaring she has married herself. She shared a series of photos and videos ahead of her solo honeymoon.

Ram Charan's Game Changer song finds a fan Korean rapper AooraKorean singer Aoora has taken the internet by storm with his electrifying dance performance to actor Ram Charan's song Raa Macha Macha. The song is from Charan's upcoming film Game Changer.

sports.headline: Used to travel in trains by the toilets: Sakshi Malik on career strugglesIn an interview with India Today, firmer India wrestler Sakshi Malik discussed her early struggles as a wrestler, including travelling by train next to toilets. She also shared insights from her autobiography Witness and her experience in the wrestlers' protest.

KL Rahul shouldn't be benched after just one Test match: Venkatapathy RajuFormer India cricketer Venkatapathy Raju has come out in support of struggling batter KL Rahul and backed him to get selected in the second Test against New Zealand in Pune.

Sarfaraz Khan welcomes baby boy a day after Bengaluru Test heroicsSarfaraz Khan announced the birth of his baby boy just a day after his impressive 150-run performance in India's Bengaluru Test against New Zealand. He shared the first picture of his newborn on Instagram, alongside his father Naushad Khan.
IND vs NZ: Team India gets rousing reception in Pune ahead of 2nd TestIndian Cricket Team arrived in Pune amid loud cheers ahead of the second Test against New Zealand set to begin from October 24.

Nadal not worried about Djokovic's grand slam tally amidst retirementAs Rafael Nadal approaches his retirement, the Spanish tennis legend expressed peace with ending his career with 22 Grand Slam titles, content despite Novak Djokovic surpassing him with 24 major championships.

Ruturaj Gaikwad to lead India A on Australia tour, Ishan Kishan named wicketkeeperThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) named a 15-member India A squad for the Australia tour on Monday, October 21 announcing Ruturaj Gaikwad as captain.

WI vs ENG: Salt and Pepper to open for England? Selection news thrills fansEngland are likely to open with a new batting pair of Philip Salt and Michael Pepper in the ODI series on the tour to West Indies.

Abhishek Sharma shines in India A's thumping win over UAEIndia A secured a convincing victory over UAE, led by Abhishek Sharma's all-round brilliance, jumping to the top of Group B in the Emerging Asia Cup with two wins from two matches.

Mohammed Shami reveals IPL captaincy ambition ahead of mega auctionMohammed Shami, currently recovering from ankle surgery, expressed openness to captaining an IPL franchise. As speculation swirls about his future with Gujarat Titans, Shami remains focused on returning to full fitness for upcoming cricket challenges.

Rishabh Pant's injury has done more good than harm to him: MSK PrasadFormer India cricketer and chief selector MSK Prasad has said that Rishabh Pant's injuries have down more good than harm to the India cricketer.

Juventus social media gets hacked, announce Arda Guler as new signingJuventus's social media account was hacked, leading to a false announcement of Arda Güler's signing from Real Madrid, confusing fans. The club later clarified the situation and confirmed the hack.

As speculation swirls about his future with Gujarat Titans, Shami remains focused on returning to full fitness for upcoming cricket challenges.

Rishabh Pant's injury has done more good than harm to him: MSK PrasadFormer India cricketer and chief selector MSK Prasad has said that Rishabh Pant's injuries have down more good than harm to the India cricketer.

Juventus social media gets hacked, announce Arda Guler as new signingJuventus's social media account was hacked, leading to a false announcement of Arda Güler's signing from Real Madrid, confusing fans. The club later clarified the situation and confirmed the hack.

Glenn Phillips on dismissing Virat Kohli: He's one of the biggest wickets in TestsNew Zealand all-rounder Glenn Phillips revealed the reason behind his wild celebration after dismissing Virat Kohli in the first Test in Bengaluru.

Familiar territory: India's history of comebacks after losing 1st TestIndia have been put in a precarious position after losing to New Zealand in the first Test match of the series. The loss means that India might not been able to rest its player before the crucial BGT 2024/25.

Mohammed Shami defends Rohit Sharma's decision to bat first in Bengaluru TestIndia fast bowler Mohammed Shami defended captain Rohit Sharma for his decision to bat first in the first Test against New Zealand in Bengaluru.

Watch: Navdeep Saini's time-wasting tactics in Ranji Trophy goes viralIn a thrilling Ranji Trophy encounter, Delhi managed to secure a draw against Tamil Nadu, thanks to Navdeep Saini's dramatic time-wasting tactics. Saini's antics on the field have since gone viral, sparking widespread amusement and admiration.

Shouldn't have happened: Sakshi Malik on Vinesh's Paris Olympics taleSakshi Malik sympathized with Vinesh Phogat over her Paris Olympics disqualification but stressed that the decision, based on UWW's strict rules, was justified. Malik also discussed how Vinesh's and Bajrang Punia's decisions impacted their protest's credibility.

Women's T20 World Cup: Harmanpreet Kaur only Indian in team of the tournamentThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced the team of the Women's T20 World Cup 2024 where only captain Harmanpreet Kaur featured from India.

Jos Buttler out of West Indies ODIs, Liam Livingstone named England captainLiam Livingstone will captain England in the upcoming ODI series against the West Indies as Jos Buttler continues to recover from a calf injury. Buttler is expected to return for the T20 series starting November 9 in Barbados.

Arsenal to use Bournemouth loss pain in Shakhtar Donetsk clash: Mikel ArtetaArsenal boss Mikel Arteta has asked his side to channel the pain from their recent loss to Bournemouth and use it in their upcoming clash against Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League.

Shouldn't have happened: Sakshi Malik on Vinesh's Paris Olympics taleSakshi Malik sympathized with Vinesh Phogat over her Paris Olympics disqualification but stressed that the decision, based on UWW's strict rules, was justified. Malik also discussed how Vinesh's and Bajrang Punia's decisions impacted their protest's credibility.

Women's T20 World Cup: Harmanpreet Kaur only Indian in team of the tournamentThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced the team of the Women's T20 World Cup 2024 where only captain Harmanpreet Kaur featured from India.

Jos Buttler out of West Indies ODIs, Liam Livingstone named England captainLiam Livingstone will captain England in the upcoming ODI series against the West Indies as Jos Buttler continues to recover from a calf injury. Buttler is expected to return for the T20 series starting November 9 in Barbados.

Arsenal to use Bournemouth loss pain in Shakhtar Donetsk clash: Mikel ArtetaArsenal boss Mikel Arteta has asked his side to channel the pain from their recent loss to Bournemouth and use it in their upcoming clash against Shakhtar Donetsk in the Champions League.

Ranji Trophy: Tamil Nadu miss 4 points in Delhi, Mumbai return to winning waysRanji Trophy 2024-25: Tamil Nadu missed out on a victory in New Delhi after Navdeep Saini came up with a resolute effort in the final hour of play. Delhi, who were forced to follow-on, avoided defeat by two wickets. Mumbai, meanwhile, returned to winning ways at home.

Barcelona's Jules Kounde eyes El Clasico 'revenge' over Real Madrid's TchouameniJules Kounde is eager to seek revenge on Real Madrid's Aurelien Tchouameni as FC Barcelona and their arch-rivals prepare for a crucial El Clásico showdown with the La Liga top spot on the line.

PAK vs ENG: Giant fans return in Pakistan for Rawalpindi pitch ahead of 3rd TestPitch curators at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium were seen using giant fans to dry the pitch ahead of the third Test against England.

Hockey set to be axed from 2026 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow: ReportsReports suggest that hockey might not feature in the 2026 Commonwealth Games as Glasgow looks to streamline the event for budgetary reasons. The official announcement regarding the sports programme is expected soon.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
